Player History
Signed as a free agent by Atlanta on 4/3/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $1,504,000 per year...
Had first career hit on 4/4/1985, off Bill Gullickson (MON)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/11/1985, off Ken Dixon (PHI)...
2/2/1986: Gets a new one-year contract worth $3,085,714 through salary arbitration...
Had 21-game hitting streak snapped on 5/18/1986...
Injured on 6/24/1986 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Sets a new season NL-Record for Hits with 214 on 9/30/1986...
2/2/1987: Gets a new one-year contract worth $4,235,714 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Atlanta to Los Angeles on 6/24/1987 (Going to LAD: P Zane Smith, P Paul Assenmacher, 2B Julio Franco. Going to ATL: P Ramon Martinez, P Paul Abbott, P Shawn Hillegas, P Chris Hammon
d)...
Was selected to the 1987 Allstar game...
7/12/1987: Signed a contract extension with Los Angeles, $8,150,000 per year, for 5 years.
Traded from Los Angeles to Chicago on 4/11/1988 (Going to LAD: P Dave Pavlas, C Damon Berryhill, LF Lou Frazier, RF Dave Martinez. Going to CHC: 2B Julio Franco, RF Dave Parker)...
Was selected to the 1988 Allstar game...
Injured on 9/27/1988 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 10/10/1988 with a Torn Tricep Muscle, out for 5 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/10/1989, hitting .500 with 1 HR, 8 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against San Diego on 7/16/1989...
Won Batter of the Month award on 8/1/1989, hitting .404 with 4 HR, 29 RBI...
Injured on 4/15/1990 with a Strained Achilles Tendon, out for 1-2 weeks...
